Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; single band in added white above part of lotus flower in faded white outline with traces of added red on petals and two white lines running up to white band above; exterior: brown band near bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The two short vertical lines connecting with the band above the lotus flower is unusual. The lack of decoration on the exterior surface of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Chalice Style vases is not usually extensive and filling ornament, with the exception of a simple rim pattern, a single elaborate rosette and simple handle zone pattern, is absent. Some later Black Figure Komast and Animal chalices do not have any filling ornament either.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1234) (phase 2)
